page.topic: How to Search for multiple Logical values in a List Control
page.description: When searching for logical values in a list control, you need to use a dropdownbox, not a checkbox, in the Search Part.

description.p: When you have a List control (based on a SQL datasource) in a UX component it is common to add a button to the UX to allow the user to filter the data shown in the List.
If the List contains one for more logical fields (say 'Employee', 'Customer' and 'Vendor'), you might want to be able to enter searches such as:

case.description: Find all records where 'Employee' is true (don't care about the start of 'Customer' or 'Vendor')
Find all records where 'Employee' is false (don't care about the start of 'Customer' or 'Vendor')
Find all records where 'Customer' is true (don't care about the start of 'Employee' or 'Vendor')

description.p: If you add logical checkbox controls to your UX to enter your search criteria for 'Employee', 'Customer' and 'Vendor' then you will not be able to perform the above searches because the UX assumes that the state of a unchecked checkbox is false.
So if you check 'Employee' but leave 'Customer' and 'Vendor' unchecked and you submit your search, the actual search that will be performed is

section.example: Employee = true and Customer = false and Vendor = false

figure.title: Searching Logical Fields in a List using Checkboxes.

description.p: This is not the same as "Find all records where 'Employee' is true (don't care about the start of 'Customer' or 'Vendor')"
The solution is to change the controls that are used for entering search criteria for 'Employee', 'Customer' and 'Vendor' to dropdownbox control with the following choices:

figure.title: Setting the choices for a dropdownbox to be used for searching logical fields.

section.description: Using dropdownboxes, the search will now find records in the List for only the logical fields you wish to query, omitting other fields from the search because nothing was selected for either the 'Customer' or 'Vendor' fields.

figure.title: Searching logical fields in a List using dropdownboxes.

section.note: For best results when using a dropdownbox to search logical fields, set the *[ui:Type]* for the drodownbox to *[ui:Character]*.
